translation.en: I am changing the way women's prisons are run.
translation.ko: 저는 여성 교도소 운영 방식을 바꿔놓을 거예요

translation.en: Strong leadership, dynamic vision, the ability to inspire. I tick every box.
translation.ko: 리더십, 훌륭한 비전 영감을 주는 능력까지 다 갖췄죠

translation.en: Weak leaders just get taken advantage of. Not on my watch.
translation.ko: 약한 리더는 이용만 당하는데 저는 그런 꼴 못 봐요

translation.en: Where's my watch?
Has anyone seen a watch?
And the cameras are going to be with us all the time…
translation.ko: 카메라가 계속 우리 주변에서 돌아갈 거예요

translation.en: -[inmates] Whoo! -…which will be a little strange at first, I'm sure, for all of us.
translation.ko: 처음에는 당연히 우리 모두 좀 어색하겠죠

translation.en: -Are we gonna be on the telly, miss? -I expect that is the general idea, yes.
translation.ko: - TV 출연하나요, 소장님? - 보통 그렇게 생각하겠죠

translation.en: This pilot scheme to mount a musical,
West Side Story, no less, is an incredible opportunity.
-I'm excited, and I'm excited for you. -Is that one of your artsy ideas, miss?
translation.ko: 여러분의 모습이 기대되네요 예술적인 아이디어가 또 있나요?

translation.en: Too many people think they know who prison inmates are
and what prison life is like, without ever setting foot inside one.
translation.ko: 죄수와 감옥 생활에 대해 잘 안다고 착각해요

translation.en: -Yeah. -Too right.
So, let's put the record straight.
Let's break some misconceptions. Let's smash some stereotypes.
Be yourselves. You've got nothing to hide.
translation.ko: 솔직한 모습을 보여줘요 일부러 숨기지 말고

translation.en: -She has. She's just nicked your watch! -[laughter]
translation.ko: 얘는 숨겨요 방금 소장님 시계를 훔쳤거든요!

translation.en: You are being given the chance to do something truly creative
translation.ko: 마침내 순수하게 창조적인 일을 할 기회가 주어졌어요

translation.en: while challenging yourself and having your voices heard, literally.
translation.ko: 자기 자신에게 도전하고 말 그대로 목소리를 내는 거예요

translation.en: -[Jean] Can we do Annie? -Just let me finish.
We've got a surprise director coming in.
The research is out there, the data has spoken,
so remember, creativity leads to… [all] rehabilitation.
translation.ko: 그러니 기억하세요, 여러분은 창의성으로 다시 태어나는 겁니다

translation.en: -Thank you. -What about Dirty Dancing?
-Hamilton! -I like Phantom.
-The King and I. -What about Mary Poppins?
-Dreamgirls! -Okay.
Not up for discussion, we're doing West Side Story,
translation.ko: 지금은 토론 시간이 아니에요 '웨스트사이드 스토리'로 갑니다

translation.en: so get your names down and start singing! Thank you.
translation.ko: 그러니 이름 적고 노래를 시작하세요! 감사합니다

translation.en: -Do you fancy the cameraman, miss? -[inmate] Oh!
No.
Can someone get my watch back, please?
Sorry.
-Well, it don't look clean! -[chattering]
-Someone's getting their hair did. -[inmate] Yeah, I know.
translation.ko: - 누가 머리를 손질하나 보네 - 나도 알아

translation.en: What have I told you about laying those edges though, boo?
translation.ko: 머리를 땋을 때는 내가 어떻게 하라고 했지?

translation.en: You're not allowed no more. Twitter said so.
translation.ko: 이제 하면 안 돼 트위터가 그렇게 말했어

translation.en: She can do it.
So can she.
She probably could, but it'd look ridiculous.
translation.ko: 이 사람은 어떨지 모르겠지만 꽤 이상해 보이겠네

translation.en: This one definitely can't. You had that?
translation.ko: 이 사람은 절대 안 돼 이해했나?

translation.en: Pretend Parker Bowles, that's a look-a-likey.
translation.ko: 차라리 보울스 공작부인을 따라 해 정말 닮았으니까

translation.en: Serial shoplifter. Couldn't make it up.
translation.ko: 연쇄 절도범이었지 결국 도망갈 수 없었어

translation.en: She's an absolute beast.
You can't be doing that either, boos. That is cultural appropriation.
translation.ko: 너도 하면 안 돼 요즘은 문화 전유라고 하지

translation.en: We got bored.
Well, tell that to the court of public opinion.
translation.ko: 그런 얘기는 법원에 가서 자기 변론할 때 하도록

translation.en: If Adele can't do it, I don't see how you can.
translation.ko: 아델이 안 되면 너희도 안 되는 거야

translation.en: Elizabeth Fry, the great prison reformer, once said,
translation.ko: 위대한 교도소 개혁가 엘리자베스 프라이가 말했죠

translation.en: "It is an honor to be on the side of the afflicted."
I say, "Hear, hear."
Except the murderers.
And the pedophiles.
Most sex offenders.
All sex offenders.
But…
all the others, I'm right behind.
translation.ko: 그런 죄목이 아니라면 저는 여러분을 지지할 거예요

translation.en: [Vicki] Put it down there.
Name?
Angela Brookes.
Sign and date there for your belongings.
Is this your first time in prison, Angela?
Yeah.
Well, you'll settle in.
Right, come on. This way.
Did I set out to be governor of a women's prison? I did not.
translation.ko: "모든 수감자는 동행 필요" 교도소장이 될 계획이었느냐고요? 아니요

translation.en: Was this the tier-one dream? No.
Was it the tier-two dream? Barely.
But I'm not the kinda person who walks away from a challenge,
translation.ko: 이런 종류의 도전을 피하는 사람이 아니었을 뿐이죠

translation.en: and when one's head is hunted,
one sticks it firmly on the pike and marches into battle.
I was headhunted from my previous job.
-In events. -Yes.
-Thank you, Dean. That's Dean. -I'm her number two.
translation.ko: - 고마워, 딘, 딘입니다 - 제가 이분 오른팔입니다

translation.en: -Not that I need one. -You don't need a number two?
translation.ko: - 사실, 필요 없어 - 오른팔이 필요 없다고요?

translation.en: I've never needed a number two.
translation.ko: 오른팔이 돼 달라고 한 적 없어

translation.en: Laura came through the back door of nepotism
translation.ko: 로라는 높은 자리에 아무런 혈연이 없었는데도

translation.en: and got promoted through over confidence.
Governor of the prison? We know what this is.
Positive discrimination.
She got the job just 'cause she's a woman,
and I'm now spending my days trying to get her to say "number two" on camera.
translation.ko: 저는 카메라 앞에서 '오른팔' 얘기나 하고 있죠

translation.en: It's a small victory for overqualified men in the workplace everywhere.
translation.ko: 자격이 넘치는 남자가 직장에서 받는 대우가 고작 이거예요

translation.en: You all right? I can see what's happened here.
translation.ko: 다들 괜찮나? 무슨 일인지 뻔히 알겠다

translation.en: What's happened here?
-What, my bump? -Yeah.
-Pregnancy, innit? -Pregnancy and in jail?
Parents must be proud.
What is it today?
Shit. Why don't we never have tacos?
[No Hat Cathy] Tacos and tacos. Tacos and tacos.
-First day? -Yeah.
Do I need to know how many days?
Do you just sit up in bed all night and compile loads of questions--
translation.ko: 잠자리에 들 때마다 그렇게 질문이 가득해서...

translation.en: For goodness sake, Doug! Every time!
Laura, you really need to make a decision.
Yes, I know. Plumbing. General maintenance, etcetera, etcetera.
translation.ko: 그래, 나도 알아, 수도관 일반 시설 보수, 기타 등등

translation.en: -Thank you, Douglas. -It's important.
I spy with my little eye something beginning with "new inmate."
translation.ko: 드디어 수감자가 처음 교도소에 들어오는 순간을 목격했네요

translation.en: First timer?
Probably not.
I'm Laura Willis. I'm the governor.
And I want you to know, your crime is of no importance to me.
translation.ko: 당신 범죄는 나한테 전혀 중요하지 않으니 걱정 마요

translation.en: -Good. Because I'm not-- -I don't need to know.
-Well, look, I think you should-- -Ah, ah, ah.
-I am not judging you on your worst day. -I'm not an inmate.
translation.ko: - 사람을 함부로 판단하면 안 되죠 - 저는 수감자가 아니에요

translation.en: Well, you are.
But you start afresh right here, right now. The slate is clean.
translation.ko: 이제 여기서 다시 시작하면 돼요 당신 기록은 깨끗해졌어요

translation.en: I'm Cheryl Fergison.
That's the spirit, Cheryl Fergison. Welcome.
You're Cheryl Fergison.
That's exactly who you are.
Ex-soap star, not a prisoner.
Well, a prisoner of your own talents. I'm so sorry I didn't recognize you.
translation.ko: 죄라면 당신 연기력이 죄겠죠 몰라봐서 미안해요

translation.en: -You look nothing like your photo. -What? This photo?
Is that you?
Yes.
Wowza.
So, West Side Story. Very exciting.
Let me know if you need anything from me, but I don't think you'll have any problem.
translation.ko: 필요한 건 뭐든지 말해줘요 하지만 큰 문제는 없을 거예요

translation.en: -What do you mean? -You know, just fitting in.
You know, all this.
This will all be… [whispers] beneficial.
-Why? -'Cause just…
Everything works.
This your guard? Do you want a bigger one?
translation.ko: 이분이 당신 경호원이에요? 덩치 큰 사람을 구해줄까요?

translation.en: Do you even need one?
I mean, well, she's here now, so…
Go on, off you go. Drum up some business!
Good luck! You won't need it.
translation.ko: 행운을 빌어요! 모든 게 잘될 거예요

translation.en: See you, Cheryl. I meant to say, I'm a big fan.
translation.ko: 나중에 봐요, 셰릴 당신의 엄청난 팬이에요

translation.en: I'm Dean, by the way. Laura's number two.
Wasn't my choice!
To keep the prison board happy, I was forced to have a number two.
translation.ko: 교도소 이사회 비위를 맞추려면 오른팔이 있어야만 했죠

translation.en: Musicals? In prison? Hell to the yes.
No creativity, no rehabilitation.
Which, incidentally, is the upcoming subject of my TED talk.
translation.ko: 제 TED 강연 주제로 삼을까 봐요

translation.en: What's that called again?
"I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings:
translation.ko: '새장에 갇힌 새가 왜 노래하는지 나는 아네'

translation.en: How Women in Prison Thrive through Music and Song."
translation.ko: '교도소의 여자들이 어떻게 음악과 춤을 통해 부흥했는가'

translation.en: -When's that happening then? -No date set.
translation.ko: - 대체 언제 그렇게 되는데요? - 날짜는 몰라

translation.en: -So, never. -It's upcoming.
translation.ko: - 안 된다는 소리네요 - 곧 될 거야

translation.en: Anyway, that is why I've asked Cheryl Fergison,
translation.ko: 어쨌든 그런 이유로 셰릴 퍼기슨을 초청했어요

translation.en: aka Ms. Heather Trott, to come and direct West Side Story.
translation.ko: 헤더 트로트 선생님이 뮤지컬을 지휘하러 오신 거죠

translation.en: -Not an obvious choice. -Not her first rodeo.
translation.ko: - 최선의 선택은 아니었어요 - 셰릴은 잘 해낼 거야

translation.en: As it turns out, Cheryl has lots of experience working with prisoners
translation.ko: 셰릴은 수감자들과 함께 일해 본 경험이 많대요

translation.en: doing drama workshops and whatnot.
When does she have time for all her rodeos?
She's also a well-loved face from stage and screen,
translation.ko: 셰릴은 무대와 영화에서 쉽게 사랑받는 얼굴이기도 해요

translation.en: which everyone will be excited about.
Big shout going out to the EastEnders massive.
I've never seen it. It's a popular soap opera about Cockneys.
translation.ko: 저는 본 적이 없는데 가난한 런던 사람들 얘기래요

translation.en: Yes, I was on EastEnders,
which does make you very recognizable.
But people move on, as have I, as have the audience.
The public see me as a versatile actress
translation.ko: 요즘 대중들 눈에는 연속극 출연 배우가 아니라

translation.en: rather than a character I once played on a soap.
All right, Heather? Thought you were dead.
I'm Gary, by the way.
Soap royalty.
Calm down, Gary. She's only human.
translation.ko: 진정해, 게리 저분도 그냥 사람일 뿐인데

translation.en: I'll be all right in a minute.
It's just a great day.
[Marco] What do you like most about Cheryl, Gaz?
translation.ko: 셰릴의 어떤 점이 가장 좋아요, 게리?

translation.en: The way she just floats through the scenes.
She floats convincingly, don't she?
The nature of her floating is authentic.
Yeah.
And EastEnders needed her at that time as well, because…
Big time.
-Saved it. -Saved it.
-Saved it. -Saved it.
Do you know the most important factor in not reoffending?
translation.ko: 재범률을 낮추기 위해 뭐가 가장 중요한지 알아?

translation.en: Stable home life.
Is it? Do you know the other most important factor?
translation.ko: 그래? 그럼, 다음으로 중요한 게 뭔지 알아?

translation.en: -Regular employment? -Shall I tell you?
-Sure. -Creativity.
-This about your little musical project? -Creativity,
a sense of purpose, self-esteem.
And my "little musical project"--
government-funded scheme soon to be rolled out nationally--
translation.ko: 정부의 지원을 받아 곧 국가적으로 유명해질 거고...

translation.en: is a step in the right direction.
And if I know these women,
they will run towards this opportunity and leap into its arms.
translation.ko: 이 여자들은 곧장 기회의 품으로 뛰어들 거야

translation.en: -All right, ladies. How are we doing? -[cheering]
translation.ko: 좋아요, 여러분 다들 잘 지내고 있나요?

translation.en: Oh, my God!
Oh, my God! I'm so excited!
It's fantastic to be here. Who's up for a bit of West Side Story?
translation.ko: 만나게 돼서 기뻐요 '웨스트사이드 스토리' 할 사람?

translation.en: -Me! -It's a story of two rival gangs,
-so some of you might enjoy that aspect. -You know who you are, boos.
There'll be proper rehearsals, we'll bring in an orchestra.
translation.ko: 정식 리허설을 할 거고 오케스트라도 데려올 거예요

translation.en: And at the end, we'll put on a banging show
that your friends and family can come and see.
This one's killed all hers.
Right! Well, as you may or may not know, my name is--
translation.ko: 좋아요, 여러분들이 제 이름을 알지 모르겠지만...

translation.en: -Heather Trott! -[laughter]
It's Cheryl Fergison.
Get outta my pub!
-Thought you was dead, Heather. -Who killed you, again?
translation.ko: - '죽은 줄 알았어, 헤더' - '또 누가 널 죽였어?'

translation.en: -So, a little bit about me. -You're Heather Trott!
Trott, Trott, Trott, Trott, Trotter!
Are you finished?
-[laughter] -I think they're finished now, boo.
Sorry, I'm a bit confused.
I've given up my time to do something nice for you,
translation.ko: 여러분을 즐겁게 해주려고 제 시간을 들이는데

translation.en: and it appears that you're treating me like a bit of a mug.
So, don't do that, 'cause I'm not.
And here's the dealio.
Join in, don't join in, makes no odds to me.
translation.ko: 공연을 하든 말든 나한테는 아무 상관 없어요

translation.en: Just remember a couple of things. One, don't be a cunt. And two, that's it.
translation.ko: 몇 가지만 기억해요, 첫째 못되게 굴지 말 것, 그게 다예요

translation.en: Mike drop.
Well, I do, Dean. I reject the whole concept.
-Of having a number two? -I see it as a form of weakness.
translation.ko: - 오른팔을 가지는 거 말이에요? - 나약해 보이니까

translation.en: As governor of this prison, the last thing I need people to see
is an insipid little number two trailing behind me.
translation.ko: 멍청한 오른팔이 등 뒤에 버티고 서 있는 거야

translation.en: If you've finished, could we please have a conversation about--
translation.ko: 말씀 다 하셨으면 제발 그 일에 관해 얘기를...

translation.en: Plumbing? Plumbing?
Well, it's actually quite serious, so if--
Hello? Oh. I'm sorry, Doug, I'm gonna have to take this.
translation.ko: 여보세요? 미안하지만, 더그 이 전화는 받아야 해

translation.en: Oh, Doug. I'm only joking.
Doug and I basically want the same thing. We want to improve this prison.
translation.ko: 결국 더그와 내 목적은 똑같아요 한층 발전한 교도소

translation.en: Now, Doug's interpretation of that is something about fixing the plumbing,
translation.ko: 이제 더그는 수도관 수리 얘기를 하려나 봐요

translation.en: whereas I focus more on artistic endeavor,
translation.ko: 반면에 저는 예술적인 성과에 초점을 맞추고 있어요

translation.en: and let's be honest, what's more important in the day-to-day life of an inmate?
translation.ko: 솔직해지기로 하죠, 수감자들에게 둘 중에 뭐가 더 중요할까요?

translation.en: [Doug] Could it be plumbing?
So, with that in mind, I have invested in personalized… [exaggerated Italian accent] librettos.
Hand printed on cream parchment
for every member of the West Side Story cast.
Government funding didn't quite stretch to that,
so what's a gal to do?
She finds it somewhere else!
What's a libretto?
A… [exaggerated accent] libretto is the extended text of a vocal work.
-Do you mean the words to the songs? -Expensive? Yes.
translation.ko: 노래 가사라고요? 비싸냐고요? 네 가치가 있냐고요? 당연하죠

translation.en: Worth it? Most definitely.
-What else are prison budgets for? -Plumbing.
-What could improve their lives more? -Plumbing.
translation.ko: - 뭐가 삶의 질을 높일까요? - 수도관 공사요

translation.en: Do you know how many other women's prisons have invested in handbound librettos
translation.ko: 여성 교도소 중에 20세기 가장 유명한 뮤지컬 대본을

translation.en: of the greatest musical of the 20th century?
translation.ko: 직접 만들어주는 교도소가 몇 개나 된다고 생각해요?

translation.en: -None? -None.
I like Laura, I do, but, uh, she doesn't make it easy, though.
translation.ko: 저는 로라를 좋아해요 하지만 어려운 사람이죠

translation.en: She rarely listens, she won't take advice.
translation.ko: "더그" 남의 말을 듣지도 않고 조언을 수용하지도 않아요

translation.en: I think she's quite forgetful, and if there's a problem…
-[Laura] If I want an idiot… -…she's usually the cause of it.
Last year the electrics needed rewiring.
Instead she chose to install nature walls
to promote a sense of calm and improve vibes generally.
translation.ko: 안정적인 느낌을 주고 좋은 분위기를 내고 싶었대요

translation.en: -Oh, you fuck off! Yeah, yeah… -[indistinct] You fuck off!
Didn't work. But you just can't help liking her.
translation.ko: 소용없었어요 그래도 로라를 싫어할 수는 없죠

translation.en: -Oh, sorry to disturb you. Good moment? -[Jean] All right.
-Um, do you like dancing and stuff? -No, not really.
Oh, you don't like dancing. What about singing?
-No. -Well, can I put you down for costumes?
-In what? -Do you want to be in a musical?
-Yeah. -Great. Okay.
Okay. I'll put you down then, yeah?
-All right, cheers then. -Thanks.
Ladies, we're doing a musical.
I was wondering if I could put you down for something?
Some singing, some dancing, some-- Any--
translation.ko: 노래할 사람, 춤을 출 사람 아니면...

translation.en: [harmonizing] ♪ Some people can hold it together ♪
♪ Last through all kinds of weather ♪
♪ Can we? ♪
Great.
[Sal] What are we?
Gay for the stay.
I mean, it's not for everyone, late onset lesbianism.
translation.ko: "캘 - 샐" 누구나 레즈비언이 될 수는 없지만

translation.en: But my goodness, we're giving it a go.
So, uh, are you up for it?
-Yeah. -What about you, my love?
I've heard I'll get out of a load of shit stuff if I do it,
translation.ko: 뮤지컬에 참여하면 일을 줄여준다는 얘기를 들었어요

translation.en: so I might as well.
Unless it's shit. And then I'll stop.
Oh, right. That's the spirit. [chuckles]
West Side Story? That sounds boring,
like all her ideas.
Boring, pointless, badly executed, benefiting no one.
translation.ko: "찰리" 지루하고, 의미 없고 잘못 흘러가서, 이득이 없어요

translation.en: So these are my choices:
singing olde worlde songs about Sharks and Jet Skis or something,
translation.ko: 샤크파와 제트 무슨 파에 대해 구식 노래를 부르거나

translation.en: or finishing my boring parenting course for a baby I don't even want.
translation.ko: 원하지도 않는 아이를 품고 지긋지긋한 태교 수업을 끝내거나

translation.en: There's not much in it, really.
[Cheryl] All right, what about you then? You tempted?
It's something to do for the next six weeks, innit?
translation.ko: 다음 6주 동안 하게 될 일이에요, 어때요?

translation.en: Oh, gosh, no, no, I'm not cut out for that sort of thing.
Um, also, I'm just in on remand. Just waiting for my trial date.
translation.ko: 그리고 저는 구류예요 재판 결과를 기다리는 중이죠

translation.en: My lawyer says I won't be in here that long, anyway.
translation.ko: 변호사 말이 금방 나갈 수 있을 거랬어요

translation.en: I don't see how I can be, because I didn't do it.
translation.ko: 왜 여기 있는지도 모르겠어요 저는 결백한데

translation.en: [Jean] We all didn't do it, love!
No, but I re-- I really didn't do it.
Well, if your trial turns into a sentence, you know where to find me. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 만약 형을 살게 되면 언제든지 날 찾아와요

translation.en: Hey there, Cheryl!
I want be a part of that. Put me on the list. My name's Sian.
translation.ko: 저도 참여하고 싶어요 목록에 넣어줘요, 시안이에요

translation.en: Bit weird in here, innit?
We don't say, "weird."
We say, "Welsh."
Sian is from Wales.
That beautiful country that borders England to the west.
translation.ko: 영국의 서쪽 국경에 있는 아름다운 시골요

translation.en: Not the mammal.
She speaks with the rich melody of her motherland.
translation.ko: 웨일스 방언은 꼭 노래하는 것 같아요

translation.en: It's just a shame no one knows what she's saying.
So, when she requested full traditional costume
translation.ko: 그래서 시안이 켈트 관습에 친숙해지고 싶다며

translation.en: to feel closer to her Celtic heritage, I was happy to oblige.
translation.ko: 전통 의상을 요구했을 때 기꺼이 들어줬어요

translation.en: At least, I think that's what she asked for.
translation.ko: 최소한 제가 알아들은 대로 기꺼이 들어줬죠

translation.en: [thick Welsh accent] Only went to ask for a hypoallergenic pillow.
And she gave me this.
I'm still all bunged up.
-Is it ice cream? -Yeah, but it's shit.
Why can't we ever have Cornettos?
[inmates] ♪ Just one Cornetto, give it to me ♪
-Why are you not joining in the singing? -Um…
translation.ko: - 이탈리아의 맛있는 아이스크림… - 당신은 왜 노래 안 하죠?

translation.en: -What have you got against Cornettos? -Nothing, I just don't know the words.
translation.ko: - 코메토에 반감이 있어요? - 아니요, 단어 뜻을 모를 뿐이죠

translation.en: -Oh, that's convenient. -What?
-Why are you shouting? -I'm not, I--
Be careful.
Heather!
Heather!
Is there going to be an audience for your show, Heather?
Is there going to be people watching at the end, like?
Because if there is, I'll be in it, and me mammy will come see it.
translation.ko: 만약 공연에 참여하면 어머니가 보러 오실 거예요

translation.en: This one's for my mammy.
That's why it says "Mammy". Are you watching that one on your camera?
translation.ko: 그래서 '어머니'라고 새겼어요 지금 찍고 있는 거죠?

translation.en: Like.
That one. I've got loads of 'em.
I get-- I get them when I'm happy. I get them when I'm sad.
translation.ko: 기쁠 때나 슬플 때나 문신을 새겼죠

translation.en: When they locked my mammy up for the first time,
I couldn't cry, I was too numb.
So, I got that one.
And the pain of the needle was so bad
that the tears came and they wouldn't stop.
translation.ko: 눈물이 줄줄 흘렀는데 멈출 수가 없었어요

translation.en: They call it a cathartic experience or some shite.
I think that's all bollocks, I just like having pictures on my arm.
translation.ko: 제 생각엔 개소리예요 팔에 그림을 새기고 싶었을 뿐인데

translation.en: That's the one I got. There.
Birds.
That was supposed to be me, but it didn't turn out right.
translation.ko: 원래는 제 얼굴을 새기려고 했는데 잘 안 됐고요

translation.en: Will I do a tattoo on you?
I'll get my needle.
You've got none on your arm.
That's great. That's just, like, fresh meat.
translation.ko: 좋은 거예요 신선한 고기 같은 거니까

translation.en: I just go "pew-pew-pew-pew-pew".
Pffft… with the blood.
'Cause I'm not very good.
What's it like being on the TV? Did you like being on the TV?
translation.ko: TV에 나오는 거예요? 당신은 TV 출연이 좋았어요?

translation.en: Did they call you Heather all the time?
-What is your real name again? -It's Cheryl.
That's nice. I'm Ros. Write that down in your book there.
Is it R-O-S or R-O-Z?
I don't know, I can't read.
Yeah, that looks grand.
Heather, it… [groans]
Cheryl…
Me girl will be in it and all, but she don't speak, so she can't sing.
translation.ko: 뮤지컬에 참여하겠지만 대사나 노래는 못 해요

translation.en: Cheryl.
Viv. I'm a natural-born entertainer.
I'm also incredibly violent and singing is my happy place.
translation.ko: 엄청나게 폭력적이지만 노래가 나한테 평화를 줘요

translation.en: So look no further.
I do impressions.
Gordon Ramsay, Ellen DeGeneres, Graham Norton,
translation.ko: "빅 비브" 고든 램지 엘렌 드제너러스, 그레이엄 노턴

translation.en: whoever it is does The One Show.
All the Kardashians, except the old one.
translation.ko: 제일 나이 든 사람만 빼고 모든 카다시안 집안사람을

translation.en: I can do them all. And I can do them all fucking well.
translation.ko: 제대로 따라 할 수 있어요 끝내주게 잘하죠

translation.en: And if anyone says any different, I'll fucking kill 'em.
[imitates American accent] I'm excited.
[normal voice] That was one of the Kardashians.
That was-- That was really good, Viv.
-Yeah. -That was brilliant.
I know.
So you say… [exaggerated accent] libretto.
Out of curiosity, how would you say that?
-"Barthelona." -Barcelona, that's great.
What about this one?
-[exaggerated accent] Cappuccino. -Cappuccino.
Okay, and what about…
-[exaggerated Punjabi accent] Tarka Dhal. -Sorry, what was that?
-Tarka Dhal. -Yep, that's what I thought you said.
Hey, I thought it was you. How are you getting on?
Yeah, all right. It's been a long day though. I'm going home soon.
translation.ko: 네, 좋아요, 힘든 하루였지만 곧 집에 가니까요

translation.en: Oh, yeah? Back to Albert Square?
♪ Ooh ♪
I'll be off then.
You were right. This did come in handy.
translation.ko: 당신 말이 맞았어요 제 얼굴이 잘 통하더라고요

translation.en: Plus, I dropped the c-bomb and they settled down.
Oh, my old trick. I'm glad you stopped by, Cheryl.
These are for you.
-Oh. What are they? -Handbound on cream parchment,
translation.ko: 이게 뭐죠? 크림색 종이에 직접 인쇄한 개별 '리브레토'예요

translation.en: personalized… [exaggerated accent] librettos.
What's a libretto?
Oh. Uh, the words to the songs. They were very expensive.
Uh, right.
-They look a bit of a faff. [chuckles] -Ouch.
Plus, uh, I got these off the Internet for free,
-so I'll use them if that's all right. -Hmm.
Hope you kept the receipt for those, uh, lib things.
[exaggerated accent] Librettos.
First day over.
Well, I got through it. I'm still here. [inhales deeply]
translation.ko: 어쨌든 저는 살아남았죠 아직 여기 있어요 "앤지"

translation.en: I've just got to keep going and pray for justice.
translation.ko: 계속 견뎌내면서 정의가 살아 있길 빌어야죠

translation.en: Tomorrow is a new day…
…full of promise, so there's no need to lose hope.
translation.ko: 수많은 가능성이 있어요 희망을 잃기엔 일러요

translation.en: I've just got to keep strong and have faith.
translation.ko: 굳세게 견디면서 믿음을 잃지 않을 거예요

translation.en: And know that everything is gonna be all right in the end.
Because it's like I always say,
"Never underestimate how good people can be."
translation.ko: '사람이 얼마나 선해질 수 있는지 과소평가하지 마라'

translation.en: That's going nowhere.
-I can't see where I'm going. -[Pat Pat] Where did the water go?
translation.ko: - 어디로 가는지 모르겠어 - 물이 왜 안 나와?

translation.en: You fucking kidding me with this? Who put the water off?
translation.ko: 나랑 장난해? 누가 물을 잠근 거야?

translation.en: What's going on, boos?
Oh, no! No!
No, Jeanie! Jeanie, cover that up!
-Oh, no, has it gone? -[shouting in distance]
Oh, there's more of 'em! No, I'm not paid enough for this!
translation.ko: 더 늘어났어? 안 돼 월급이나 많이 주든지

translation.en: There'd better not be any fucking cameras here.
-[straw gurgles] -Water main's burst.
-What? -No water at all
in the entire prison, until it's fixed, which could take 48 hours.
What?
Well, I did warn you it was gonna happen.
-When? -When we had the conversation
where I told you the plumbing needed fixing.
They're already kicking off. Let's hope it doesn't escalate.
translation.ko: 다들 화내고 있어요 상황이 심각해지지 않길 빌죠

translation.en: Do you remember the good old days? When we used to have controlled riots.
translation.ko: 그 시절이 기억나세요? 가짜 폭동 상황극도 했잖아요

translation.en: Yes, because I believe in a safe environment, they have their place.
translation.ko: 그래, 주변이 안전하면 자기 자리를 찾으니까

translation.en: And, riot!
Please be aware of the person closest to you.
Let's bring that down by about 50%.
I wanted them to have all the fun of a riot without the danger.
translation.ko: 위험하지 않은 폭동의 재미를 맛보게 해주고 싶었어

translation.en: And how did that work out?
It was not at all fun, and it was quite dangerous.
I remember now.
Not at all fun, and quite dangerous. Wasn't that your nickname in high school?
translation.ko: 재미없었고, 꽤 위험했죠 고등학교 때 당신 별명이었나요?

translation.en: No, my nickname was Margarine.
-Why? Because your hair was always greasy? -No, because I spread easily.
translation.ko: - 왜요? 머리카락이 기름져서요? - 아니, 잘 깔려줬거든

translation.en: Oh. The librettos have arrived, I see.
-That's money well spent. -It's… [exaggerated accent] libretto!
How many fucking times?
And riot!
She's cut off our water!
Look at me. I was in there having a shower and the water just stopped.
translation.ko: 내 꼴을 봐, 샤워하고 있었는데 물이 끊겼단 말이야

translation.en: Where's our water, Willis?
